intro: Microlaelia, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plants typically grow in high-altitude regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Microlaelia species are often found in rocky soils and are adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous terrain. Their unique floral structures and ecological adaptations make them an important part of the Andean flora.
